creator: mike@osdn.org.ua
text:
There is an ongoing experiment on dynamic library usage cleanup in ALT Linux; in
particular, recent changes introduced --as-needed ld flag.

Final patch by our toolchain maintainer, Dmitry V. Levin <ldv altlinux org>, is
attached.  It should be a portable version.

creator: mike@osdn.org.ua
text:
Created attachment 17980
portable version

Argh, an older patch was lying around.	This one is portable.

Apache HTTP Server 1.3.x is not supported anymore and no bugs will be fixed in the old codebase (cf. <http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/httpd-announce/201002.mbox/%3C20100203000334.GA19021@infiltrator.stdlib.net%3E>). Since this bug seems to affect only 1.3.x, I'm closing it as WONTFIX.

If this bug still affects you in a recent version (version 2.2.x or the upcoming version 2.4), please open a new bug.

Thank you for reporting the bug.
creator: mss@apache.org
mike@osdn.org.ua
text:
Folks, thanks for all the fish with 1.x, but I'm moving to nginx where possible instead of 2.x -- performance and memory footprint do matter for me.

Good luck and thank you again.
